Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown grooved pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is bears traces of a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two Coptic (?) characters written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394082) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394082)
